did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Ten letters and notes to Everett Barnes in Dayton, Ohio. Letters from friends named Pretz (presumabley female) and Jim are possibly written by the same hand, leading to speculation that one is a psuedonym and that the letters might have some gay content. One letter by Pretz is written entirely in Morse Code. Also, several letters about amateur radio use, one from Tom Nash, and one from Harold, apparently Everett's brother. Dates span February to Dec. 1924.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Ten letters and notes to Everett Barnes in Dayton, Ohio. Letters from friends named Pretz (presumabley female) and Jim are possibly written by the same hand, leading to speculation that one is a psuedonym and that the letters might have some gay content. One letter by Pretz is written entirely in Morse Code. Also, several letters about amateur radio use, one from Tom Nash, and one from Harold, apparently Everett's brother. Dates span February to Dec. 1924.
